arts.ttl: FPL GW16 stats: Isak ends most transferred-in curse
arts.sum: What curse?" Alexander Isak (£8.6m) ended a run of six consecutive blanks for the Gameweek's most-bought player in Fantasy Premier League with two attacking returns. Elsewhere, it's advantage Cole Palmer (£11.1m) in the battle of the captains as Mohamed Salah (£13.4m) produced his lowest return since Gameweek 7, while Bukayo Saka (£10.6m) blanked.

arts.ttl: “We’ll see” – Liverpool, Arsenal, Chelsea & Newcastle all on alert after €30m star’s latest comments
arts.sum: Rayan Cherki has refused to rule out a move away from Lyon in the near future, with a host of Premier League clubs showing an interest. Cherki has caught the eye with the French giants in recent years, registering 22 goals and 31 assists in 157 appearances across all competitions since emerging in 2019. Arne […] The post “We’ll see” – Liverpool, Arsenal, Chelsea & Newcastle all on alert after €30m star’s latest comments appeared first on CaughtOffside.

arts.ttl: Isak and Murphy star as Newcastle put four past Leicester
arts.sum: Newcastle United ended their four-game Premier League winless streak after beating Leicester City 4-0 at home, handing Ruud van Nistelrooy his first defeat in charge of the Foxes. A nodded assist for Guimaraes' goal was his first at home this season and, despite his cross for Isak's header taking a kind deflection, his industry to constantly burst past Gordon shows how confident he is right now.

arts.ttl: Arsenal face Newcastle transfer challenge as Eddie Howe launches bid for £90m star
arts.sum: Newcastle are ready to challenge Arsenal and Premier League leaders Liverpool in the January transfer window, despite Eddie Howe's concerns over the Magpies compliance with financial rules

arts.ttl: Newcastle United silence Leicester City taunt as angry celebration sets tone for riot - 5 things - Ciaran Kelly - Chronicle Live
arts.sum: Newcastle were so dominant that Eddie Howe even had the luxury of taking off Bruno Guimaraes, Tino Livramento and Jacob Murphy midway through the second half while Alexander Isak and Anthony Gordon were also substituted. Newcastle went into half-time ahead, thanks to a curling effort from Jacob Murphy on the half-hour mark, and the dominant Magpies ran riot after the break.

arts.ttl: Ruud van Nistelrooy admits 'it will be hard to come back from' after Newcastle meltdown
arts.sum: Ruud van Nistelrooy suffered his first defeat as Leicester boss as the Foxes were hammered at Newcastle, with the Ducthman changing his goalkeeper at half-time of the trip to Tyneside

arts.ttl: Eddie Howe relieved to start Newcastle’s big week with a much-needed victory
arts.sum: The Magpies returned to form with a 4-0 thumping of Ruud van Nistelrooy’s Leicester.

arts.ttl: Man City eye Newcastle star as UNPRECIDENTED €180m January move looms
arts.sum: “Sources have told ESPN that Manchester City will go for Martin Zubimendi and Bruno Guimaraes in the January transfer market in order to rescue their season,” the report indicates . Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola is ready to spend big in the January transfer window after a catastrophic run of form that threatens to derail the club’s season.

arts.ttl: Newcastle United dealt double blow with two stars ruled out of festive fixtures
arts.sum: Howe also confirmed that Nick Pope will miss the rest of 2024 after the results of his scan showed damage suffered against Brentford last weekend. When asked about Joelinton's caution, Howe said: "It's bizarre how things work.

arts.ttl: Newcastle United player ratings as star scoops 10/10 and three score high in Leicester win
arts.sum: The 4-0 win saw Jacob Murphy grab two while Bruno Guimaraes and Alexander Isak helped serve up a much-needed victory in the Premier League. Another to put his Brentford nightmare behind him with solid display.
